Hunger In Texas

Every Texas community is touched by the struggle to afford enough food.

PRIMARY CTA

The Issue

Food insecurity is the most broadly-used measure of food deprivation in the United States. The USDA defines food insecurity as meaning “consistent access to adequate food is limited by a lack of money and other resources at times during the year.”

Food insecurity is most prevalent in households containing children, disabled individuals or the elderly. Every Texas county is touched by the struggle to afford enough food.

Learn More
1 in 5 Texas families experienced food insecurity in 2010-2012
▼

How do low-income texans get help feeding their children?

The Voices of Hungry Texans

Because of the economy, it is getting hard to supply enough food for the family.
Janice
Social security benefits not enough for rent, utilities, etc.
Max
We depend on food stamps for ourselves and our 2 boys. We struggled when they cut them previously, and could not make it if another cut happened.
Cheryl
I am a single mother with an income of minumum wage, trying to afford a place to live, left with no money for food.
Melissa
We depend on food stamps for ourselves and our 2 boys. We struggled when they cut them previously, and could not make it if another cut happened.
